required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Effectivity and Toxicity of Apatinib for Unresectable Advanced Chondrosarcoma: a Multicentric Retrospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: Anti-angiogenesis Tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs) have been proved to show promising effects on prolonging progression-free survival (PFS) for advanced chondrosarcoma after failure of standard multimodal Therapy. Methylsulfonic apatinib is one of those TKIs which specifically inhibits VEGFR-2. This study summarizes the experience of two Peking University affiliated hospitals in off-label use of apatinib in the treatment of extensively pre-treated chondrosarcoma.

primary_outcome.description: from initial treatment to date of recorded progression or death or last follow-up

secondary_outcome.description: from initial treatment to death or last follow-up

intervention.description: Apatinib orally 500mg once daily half an hour after meal

facility.name: Musculoskeletal Tumor Center of Peking University People's Hospital

reference.citation: Xie L, Guo W, Wang Y, Yan T, Ji T, Xu J. Apatinib for advanced sarcoma: results from multiple institutions' off-label use in China. BMC Cancer. 2018 Apr 6;18(1):396. doi: 10.1186/s12885-018-4303-z.

Xie L, Xu J, Sun X, Tang X, Yan T, Yang R, Guo W. Apatinib for Advanced Osteosarcoma after Failure of Standard Multimodal Therapy: An Open Label Phase II Clinical Trial. Oncologist. 2019 Jul;24(7):e542-e550. doi: 10.1634/theoncologist.2018-0542. Epub 2018 Dec 17.

results_reference.citation: Xie L, Xu J, Sun X, Liu K, Li X, He F, Liu X, Gu J, Lv Z, Yang R, Tang X, Yan T, Li D, Yang Y, Dong S, Sun K, Shen D, Guo W. Apatinib for Treatment of Inoperable Metastatic or Locally Advanced Chondrosarcoma: What We Can Learn About the Biological Behavior of Chondrosarcoma from a Two-Center Study. Cancer Manag Res. 2020 May 15;12:3513-3525. doi: 10.2147/CMAR.S253201. eCollection 2020.

condition_browse.mesh_term: Drug-Related Side Effects and Adverse Reactions
